subject: Sexual Health
title: Human Papillomavirus
description: A quick, practical guide to Human Papillomavirus.

hook.text: HPV is the most common STI on Earth. Nearly every sexually active person will get it at some point.

buildup.text: There are over 200 HPV strains. Most are harmless and cleared by the immune system within two years.

discovery.text: A handful of high-risk strains can cause cervical, throat, and anal cancers if they persist.

twist.text: The HPV vaccine prevents infection from the most dangerous strains and has cut cancer rates sharply.

climax.text: HPV vaccination before exposure is one of the greatest cancer prevention tools modern medicine offers.

punchline.text: A vaccine that prevents cancer. Science at its best.

quiz.question: What can high-risk HPV strains cause?
